predicate.note: Frames file for 'object' based on sentences in wsj and automatic expansion via verbnet.

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Moreover, Mr. Guber claims, Mr. Semel told him that Mr. Ross probably wouldn't object ``if it were anybody other than Sony.
example.arg: if it were anybody other than Sony

example.name: both args
example.text: Meeting in Strasbourg Wednesday, the commission voted, as expected, *trace* to formally object to the accord between Air France, the state-owned airline, and state-controlled domestic carrier Air Inter.
example.arg: the accord between Air France, the state-owned airline, and state-controlled domestic carrier Air Inter

example.name: tricky intransitive
example.text: Rural Solidarity objected, to no avail, when Solidarity leader Lech Walesa accepted the Peasants' support.
example.arg: when Solidarity leader Lech Walesa accepted the Peasants' support
